author: Nancy A. Youssef
title: Pentagon Changes Top Officer, Name for Its Command Covering Asia
text:
PEARL HARBOR, Hawaiiâ€”In a symbolic nod toward India, the U.S. military changed the name of the military headquarters covering Asia and the Pacific Ocean from Pacific Command to Indo-Pacific Command, making the shift Wednesday during a ceremony that also named its new commander.
Adm. Philip Davidson took over the newly named command at a ceremony here attended by Defense Secretary Jim Mattis and Marine Gen. Joe Dunford, the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff.
